Would you like to reset?
en.completedText: Congratulations for progressing through the Lab!! Now you know how magnets work!!
en.1: Heey! Have you ever thought of how magnets can help the environment,generating less polution and helping with traffic?
en.2: We are in a constant seek for renewable and clean energy to power up our lives and mantain a sustainable world for upcoming generations.
en.3: This is a Maglev. It's like a train, but it only requires magnetic and electric force to run, reducing the amount of cars on the streets and improving air quality.
en.4: Let me show how all those magnets and electricity works, so we can build more environment-friendly transportation around the world.
en.6: Magnets are objects that are surrounded by a <color=#ff8933>magnetic field</color>,being able to <color=#92e8c0>magnetize certain materials</color>,such as iron and steel, which repel and attract other magnets
en.7: That attraction and repulsion between two magnets is called Magnetic Force, which doesn't require contact to be applied
en.8: All the magnetized objects have a SOUTH and a NORTH pole, when you approach 2 magnets by the same pole,they repel. They attract each other when the poles are opposite!
en.9: I have a magnetic tool with me! You can press Z to turn it on and off and X to change poles.
en.10: You can also hold down the ↑ and ↓ keys to rotate the pole upwards and downwards! The above my head will mark the direction
en.11: Beware: Using my tool consumes energy. Right now I need some batteries to recharge it. Keep an eye out not to run out of energy.
en.12: There are objects which you can interact with.
en.14: You're doing great!!! Let's get to the next level
en.15: I got a new challenge for you! This level is a bit more complicated
en.16: The bigger magnets are stronger than the smaller ones, so you may use them to reach far places. The magnetic force gets weaker as it gets far, so maybe you'll need a little hop
en.17: Reminder: When magnetizing an object,the polarity will be the opposite of the affected magnetic field
en.18: A quick tip: If you switch my tool's polarity while holding a magnetized box,it will be thrown away by the magnetic force
en.19: In my lab, you're only allowed to magnetize one box at a time,so the puzzle gets harder!
en.20: Now let's introduce a bit of electric force! Do you know why electricity exists?
en.21: Electric force, like magnetic force, is a non contact energy. It cames from the electrons on a material, and they can flow through materials
en.22: Some materials can conduct more electricity than others, it depends on how the electrons are displaced on that material. We can also make those electrons move.
en.23: By friction, we can make some materials lose and gain electrons, generating static electricity! Try rubbing your feet on the carpet ahead!
en.24: Objects with opposite charges will attract each other, so they can exchange electrons and neutralize their charge
en.25: In some cases, you might feel the electric discharge. Running with hands on metal handrails in a really dry place, for instance.
en.26: And how magnet force and electricity comes together?
en.27: One way both of them interact is in electromagnets. You've already seen some in the previous stages, like my tool, that requires electricity to create the magnet field
en.28: And all the magnets on the walls, ground and ceilings are also electromagnets! The more electricity they get, the stronger they become
en.29: Fill the batteries attached to the magnet to increase the magnetic force
en.30: Another way to generate electricity is through magnetic fields in motion! When a magnetized object moves next to a conducting material, it causes the energy to flow through that material
en.31: Run through that coil and fill the battery
en.32: As you remember, electric energy flows on conducting materials. This flow is called electric current
en.33: The boxes you magnetize can get electrically charged! Take them to the plugs to procceed in this maze!
en.34: Beware: The dark static boxes ahead are made of a non-conductive material!
en.35: Now it's time to throw it all together! Do you think you can do it?
en.F0: Don't forget to change your tool's polarity to interact with the magnetic field
en.F1: The closer the objects are, the stronger the magnetic force becomes! Throw the boxes and reach higher with it!
en.F2: When charged, move quick to lose less static energy! Move the boxes wisely.
en.F3: Charge all that is needed to power the magnets and reach the goals
en.F4: Remember all the stuff you've passed, the electricity, magnetism and revise all of that in this stage's puzzle.

Would you like to reset?
es.1: Heey!¿Has pensado en como los imanes pueden ayudar lo ambiente,generando menos contaminación del aire y ablandar el tránsito?
es.2: Estamos en una constante busca por energías limpias e renovables energizar nuestras vidas y mantener un mundo sustenibile para las futuras generaciones
es.3: Esto és un Maglev. El es como un trén, pero solo necesita fuerza eletrica y magnetica para funcionar, reducindo la cuantidad de coches en las calles y mejorando la calidad del aire.
es.4: Dejame enseñar como los imanes y la eletricidad funcionan, para que nosotros hagamos transportes públicos sustentabiles por el mundo
